strings.Value: "I'm glad of your return, old friend. I will need your help."
"Jhod? How can you be here?! — You died!"
"Kesten? But I saw you die..."
"Thank you for your offer, Sir Weren. I could use your help."
"Did you really think you could fool me so easily? You are not a shadow from the cup!"
"Away, shadow! I will never trust an apparition born of the Lantern King's magic."
{n}Mumbling unhappily, Jhod steps from behind Kesten's back.{/n} "You must be watched! See what happens when you're not looked after!"

{n}The knight makes a brief bow again.{/n} "My sword is at your disposal. I will stay here for a while and help your people, but I will arrive at once when you face real danger. We shall see much of it on the road ahead."

{n}Jhod catches his breath.{/n} "You are a welcome sight, Your Highness. Look what the damned {g|Eldest}Eldest{/g} did to the city! As soon as we entered, the ground started trembling silently under our feet, and then it gave way and fell apart! But why am I telling you this — you probably saw the whole thing for yourself... So our team was stuck here, by the gate, together with a whole horde of beasts from the {g|First World}First World{/g}. We fought them off somehow, thanks to you — and Erastil! But I don't know what's going on with the others. And also... well, he'll tell you himself!"
{n}Kesten, who stood by silently until this moment, nods to you briefly, and then stares at the ground gloomily.{/n} "Happy to serve you, Your Grace... I mean — Your Highness!"

"Allow me to speak for myself, Sir Kesten." {n}The knight who helped fend off the attack steps forward and makes a curt, military bow.{/n} "Greetings, Your Highness, I humbly request you hear me out. I come from a duchy you probably haven't heard of, though it's only a day's journey from here. Many ages ago it was destroyed by the fey Nyrissa, and turned into a grain of dust for the sorceress' cursed cup."
"You can rely on old Jhod, Your Highness! I'll watch over the wounded soldiers here, and then I will catch up with you. The greatest monsters still lie ahead. A priest will come in helpful!"

"That's all very {d|c22 Kesten saved}true{/d}. But you saw what happened when the cup broke, right? The Stag Lord, Irovetti, and many others from the fallen kingdoms returned from the dead. And I returned along with them. I am a shadow... a memory of the old Jhod Kavken, may {g|Erastil}Erastil{/g} save his soul.
I wandered around the ruins until I found Kesten — and now you. What else can I do but help you?"

"{d|c22 Jhod saved}Right.{/d}" {n}Kesten sighs.{/n} "Damned fool thing... Never mind — I'm not sorry for any of it! I'm not exactly myself, Your Grace. Did you see the Stag Lord and the others who appeared from the cup? Well, I returned with them. Let the priests decide whether I'm alive or not, but no one has released me from service. I'm here now, helping as best I can."

"I suppose you've guessed who I am, or rather — what I am. Warriors from all the fallen kingdoms were kept in the cup, and many return as half-mad shadows. I have returned as well. I am the shadow of Sir Weren Degar. But, unlike the other shadows, I have no desire to fight for those who slaughtered my ruler and my people. If you'd allow me, I would help you in your noble cause as best I can."

{n}The priest hangs his head.{/n} "Why... where am I going to... ah, fine! I'll look for people in the city. Surely someone needs my help..."
{n}He walks away with his head to the ground.{/n}
{n}Kesten frowns and shrugs but does not dare argue.{/n} "As you wish, Your Highness. I'll go then... And look for someone in the city who needs help..."

"I'm impressed with your sharp eyes and deep knowledge, {mf|king|queen}. Though you are not the first mortal ruler to surprise me. And not the first one to die by my sword — for the pleasure of the true king, the {g|LanternKing}Lantern King{/g}!"
"I understand your suspicions, although I am truly sorry for it. Very well, so long, Your Highness!"

"Yes, Your Highness! I'll talk to the soldiers now, and then catch up with you. Something strange is happening up ahead. There's some monster lurking around where there used to be a tavern. But we'll help bring it down!"
"Your loss, Your Highness. Of course, he wasn't the real Jhod, but he wished us well. All right, then. We need to deal with this disaster — now."

"That was harsh, Your Highness. But I think you did the right thing. Nothing good can come of the false little god's foul magic. The real Kesten has long been far away from us — and from everything of this world."
{n}Smoke envelops the grinning shadow, changing its features.{/n}

"I'm impressed with your sharp eyes and deep knowledge, {mf|king|queen}. Though you are not the first mortal ruler to surprise me. And not the first one to die by my sword — for the pleasure of the true king, the {g|LanternKing}Lantern King{/g}!"
